items.headline: ADP says U.S. economy loses jobs for third time in four months. Fed to weigh weak labor market in rate-cut vote.
items.summary_en: Privately run businesses eliminated jobs in November for the third time in four months, pointing to a broad slowdown in hiring that threatens to nudge unemployment higher and undermine the economy.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: An AI air pocket and a struggling consumer could become a double whammy for stocks in 2026, Bank of America predicts
items.summary_en: Don’t look for outsized gains from the S&P 500 next year, the headwinds are numerous warns Savita Subramanian.

items.headline: Dollar Tree beats sales expectations, as consumers spend more on bargain items
items.summary_en: Dollar Tree’s stock is climbing as the discount retailer’s assortment of bargains, with the average cost of its items at $1.40 each, is getting people to spend more at its stores.

items.headline: ‘She’ll let him live there for free’: My sister wants to buy our impoverished brother’s house. Is that a bad idea?

items.headline: Macy’s surprises Wall Street by reporting sales growth and a profit, but the stock pulls back
items.summary_en: Macy’s reported an unexpected profit — and growth in a key sales metric — but in premarket action Wednesday, the stock gave back some of its stellar recent gains.

items.headline: ‘She’s young enough to be his granddaughter’: My dad, 85, is being seduced by his caregiver. What can I do?
items.summary_en: “He is of sound mind, but he might succumb to someone who offers him companionship.”

items.headline: Why oil producers are adding to the global supply glut despite low crude prices
items.summary_en: The major oil producers known as OPEC+ unwound previous output cuts faster than expected this year — increasing quotas at a time when global oil prices have dropped around 16% year to date.
